item.title: Stats command?
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

if (command.startsWith("stats")) { int SpyingId = PlayerManager.getPlayerID(command.substring(6)); if (SpyingId != 0) { StatsMenu(SpyingId); } }

[code] public void StatsMenu(int Stats) {
Client c = (Client) Server.PlayerManager.players[Stats];

	sendQuest(""+c.playerName+" Stats", 8144);
	sendQuest("", 8145);
	sendQuest("Attack Level is: "+c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[0]), 8151);
	sendQuest("Strength Level is: "+c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[2]), 8152);
	sendQuest("Defence Level is: "+c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[1]), 8153);
	sendQuest("Hitpoints Level is: "+c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]), 8154);
	sendQuest("Prayer Level is: "+c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[5]), 8155);
}[/code]

Not sure if it works, just typed it up, tell me if it works or not.

Edit: Ahh, didn’t refresh the post, nevermind.

Read full topic

item.title: Stats command?
item.dc:creator: @Needless Needless
item.description:
@Needless wrote:

I made a stats thingy (I hope I did it right =p)
But I don’t know how to make the command to open the StatsMenu()
I need to make it so that the person that is doing the command does ::stats [other players name]
Any help?
This is what I have in the public void:

[code] public void StatsMenu() {

playerLevel[0] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]);
playerLevel[0] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]);
playerLevel[0] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]);
playerLevel[0] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]);
playerLevel[0] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]);
sendQuest("@dre@Stats", 8144); //Title
clearQuestInterface();
sendQuest("@dre@+playerName+@dre@Stats", 8145);
sendQuest("@dbl@+playerName+@dbl@Attack Level is:" +playerXP[0], 8151);
sendQuest("@dbl@+playerName+@dbl@Strength Level is:"+playerXP[2], 8152);
sendQuest("@dbl@+playerName+@dbl@Defence Level is:"+playerXP[1], 8153);
sendQuest("@dbl@+playerName+@dbl@Hitpoints Level is:"+playerXP[3], 8154);
sendQuest("@dbl@+playerName+@dbl@Prayer Level is:"+playerXP[5], 8155);
}[/code]

Read full topic
